docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Cuomo administration, reversing an earlier stand, will let New York City distribute clean needles to hundreds of drug addicts as part of an experiment to reduce the spread of AIDS, officials familiar with the administration's thinking said today.

headline.main: Addicts to Get Needles in Plan To Curb AIDS

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Cuomo administration, reversing an earlier stand, will let New York City distribute clean needles to hundreds of drug addicts as part of an experiment to reduce the spread of AIDS, officials familiar with the administration's thinking said...

byline.original: By JEFFREY SCHMALZ, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Over lunch at Danny's Restaurant here six years ago, a brilliant medical researcher from Johns Hopkins University and two brash New York brothers who fancied themselves company founders batted around ideas for creating a drug company.

headline.main: In Hot Pursuit of a Wonder Drug

docs.snippet: LEAD: Over lunch at Danny's Restaurant here six years ago, a brilliant medical researcher from Johns Hopkins University and two brash New York brothers who fancied themselves company founders batted around ideas for creating a drug company.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: For city dwellers, winter can mean stuffy rooms and heating pipes that clank through the night. Often an open window will only yield sooty, malodorous drafts and more noise.

headline.main: Out With the Bad Air: Dirt and Noise Fighters

docs.snippet: LEAD: For city dwellers, winter can mean stuffy rooms and heating pipes that clank through the night. Often an open window will only yield sooty, malodorous drafts and more noise.
